website_summaries.verdict: The Oxo Cold Brew Coffee Maker will wow die-hard cold-brew fans willing to spend more cash for extra convenience, but it's too pricey for occasional drinkers.
pros: Simple to use, the Oxo Cold Brew Coffee Maker offers an easy way to steep and strain grounds at room temperature
Coffee made with the Oxo Cold Brew is consistently strong, sweet and delicious
Included paper filters aid the metal strainer for an extra level of filtration
cons: The Oxo Cold Brew Coffee Maker costs double the price of basic coffee products capable of cold-brewing
The Cold Brew can't brew with hot water either, and like traditional cold brew methods needs a lengthy 12 to 24 hours of steeping time

customer_reviews.title: bottom o-ring seal leaks and makes a mess. o-ring ...
customer_reviews.text: bottom o-ring seal leaks and makes a mess. o-ring or plastic sealing surface defective or incorrect o-ring compression. High price for a mess! Close examination reveals two parting lines in the black plastic stopper/valve which makes a very poor o-ring sealing surface This o-ring will fix the leaking - #142 Silicone O-Ring, 70A Durometer, Red, 2-3/8" ID, 2-9/16" OD, 3/32" Width (I design water purification equipment for a living, so I am not a twit)
customer_reviews.author: ARLLC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Coffee and Even Better Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this brewer 5 stars based on the ease of use and amazing coffee I am getting from it. The real reason I am reviewing this brewer is OXO's incredible customer service. Two weeks into ownership I dropped and shattered the carafe that is included with it. I emailed OXO inquiring about purchasing a replacement... Seven days later a FREE replacement was at my doorstep! Was an incredible surprise and I am now a customer for life. Thank you again.
customer_reviews.author: William Hart

customer_reviews.title: Great idea in need of a solution
customer_reviews.text: What a mess this machine is. After spending extra money on the coarse grind, I find that even after an hour the coffee will not drain from the pot. The hole is obviously too small and the drain just shut when I pushed it down to open it. OXO needs to work on this product and reintroduce it as it makes the best coffee I've had from a cold brew. I'll go back to my old sieve type brewer until someone makes something that drains correctly. Thanks Amazon for your great return policy.
customer_reviews.author: gerry

customer_reviews.title: The bottom mechanism needs to be cranked super tight or it leaks through the threads
customer_reviews.text: Skip it. Too many serious problems. 1. The bottom mechanism needs to be cranked super tight or it leaks through the threads. 2. The o-ring on the plunger sucks and slowly drip-leaks a substantial amount of coffee during the brew. 3. The drain button is super flakey and can sit halfway between open and closed, leading to yet more leaks. 4. It takes forever to actually let the coffee out once finished brewing. Seriously, I have no idea how this has so many good reviews and was The Wirecutter's top choice. I feel bamboozled.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A. Mizenko

customer_reviews.title: It started leaking unexpectedly after a couple months
customer_reviews.text: Mine started leaking after a few months of use. I want prepared for that and unfortunately it made a huge mess in my kitchen, messed up my table, documents, and stained my tile grout. I see now that there's a small crack on the plastic where you tighten the nozzle that's possibly the cause. This thing is not cheap so I'm very disappointed with it. The coffee itself turns out great but... So it does in other cold brew makers. Now I'll be seeing what kind of customer service OXO has I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Cold brew coffee maker makes cold brew coffee
customer_reviews.text: This cold brew coffee maker is everything you want from a cold brew coffee maker. Because it makes cold brew coffee. Just dump in the grounds. Add water. Wait. Boom, delicious cold brew coffee. It nests nicely to put away. But I don't know why you'd put away when you could be making delicious cold brew coffee. Cold brew coffee in the morning. Cold brew coffee in the afternoon. Cold brew coffee in the evening. I think I might've had too much cold brew coffee. If there is such a thing as too much cold brew coffee. Haha, right? Cold brew coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Drake Paul

customer_reviews.title: For me, there's a better way
customer_reviews.text: After using the OXO Good Grips Cold Brew Coffee Maker a few times, I switched to an alternative method I like much better. I use a stainless steel French press coffee maker (cheaper and more highly rated on Amazon than the OXO) to make a batch of hot coffee that I refrigerate in a carafe for 3-4 hours and then pour over ice. I'm not a coffee high-brow, but to me the results of this quick, simple method are at least as satisfying as cold brewing.
customer_reviews.author: HoosierCat

customer_reviews.title: Will leak everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend this product. it always leaks when brewing. Nothing short of placing it in a bucket, will keep it from leaking all over your fridge and counter. I contacted OXO about this, and they said that they would send me a replacement gasket by July. I still haven't received it, so I guess i'm out $40. I only wish that i would have watched a youtube video on how to make cold brew coffee, before buying this. apparently, all you really need is a mason jar.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Cadena

customer_reviews.title: Leaks all over, makes good cold brew
customer_reviews.text: I've used this about ten times, and it has leaked all over the fridge shelf about half those times. I finally had to throw this out after the wife threatened me with violence if she had to clean the fridge one more time. The coffee itself is pretty good tasting, which is why I kept trying it, hoping that THIS time would be the time I finally tightened it hard enough to not leak. Nope.
customer_reviews.author: Superjay

customer_reviews.title: I  didn’t think cold brew could be so good
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first but it’s very easy to set up and use and it has produced some of the best cold brew I’ve had. My one complaint is that if the grounds are too fine the water won’t find its way through and after 12 hours or so you’ll only have about a cup of liquid coffee. Otherwise it’s great. The hardest part is waiting for it to brew, which could take about 10 hours. Just remember that unless you want your cold brew super strong, to add cold water (or milk) to your glass. Invest in some good quality coffee made for cold brew and you’ll taste how good it can be.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Broke quickly
customer_reviews.text: Broke after a couple of months of weekly use - the switch sticks now and even when closed the coffee leaks through so it doesn’t steep correctly. I usually love OXO products but this one is not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: atxdori

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, Makes you want to Use it
customer_reviews.text: Well, if it's difficult to use or cleanup most likely you don't want to use it more than necessary. However, this is straightforward & if you are really picky you can use the paper filters - but the built in wire mesh works fine. It's going to sit on your counter for 18-24 hours, so it might as well look nice & this one does it well. What more to say, enjoy your coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Complimentary

customer_reviews.title: Good Cold Brew But It Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I have to give it a one star review because it leaks. When I make the cold brew the water is leaking out the bottom. Thank goodness I had the glass carafe in place or else it would have spilled all over the counter. The cold brew itself was very good but I think it was weakened because of the leak. Note that what this makes is usually twice the strength of other cold brew recipes I have seen. For this 2 oz. = 1 serving while most others 4 oz. = 1 serving.
customer_reviews.author: K. Reinke

customer_reviews.title: Cold Brew made EASY!
customer_reviews.text: The biggest issue with this is that you have to remember it really is as easy as it seems so don't complicate the process. Put your coarse grounds and water in and after 12 to 24 hours flip the lever. Don't stir it first to try to make something happen - it just will. And remember that this is a concentrate so a little of the coffee and then water and you're good. No bitter taste and it's just so easy! WE LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: T. McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: Add cloth filter to cure slow filtering process
customer_reviews.text: This is my second review of the Oxo. After criticizing how s-l-o-w the filtering process is (after the 24 Hr brewing), I went online to Amazon and bought two 12 x 12 reusable cotton cold brew bags in a package by Doppelgänger goods . I opened one up and “lined” the brew part of the Oxo with it ... Then I added my course ground decaf coffee and cold water. Problem solved. A day later I opened the small Oxo filter so it could drain and the brewbag kept all the grounds from clogging up the filter. It drained quickly and completely. I emptied the cotton bag into my compost and sprayed it clean in my kitchen sink. Yey!
customer_reviews.author: R. Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Happy to add this to my kitchen lineup
customer_reviews.text: I’ve made a couple of batches of cold-brewed coffee and am very satisfied with the results. I was never a fan of iced coffee before now, but this process makes a tasty and refreshing drink. I also made one batch of cold-brewed tea, following the directions in the users manual, and that worked out well too, though next time I think I’ll use a fruitier tea instead of orange pekoe. Experimentation is key to finding the desired proportion of water and/or milk to the concentrates that result from the cold-brewing process.
customer_reviews.author: dtobisk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cold brew maker for the coffee personalizing home brewer
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the most straightforward cold brew maker available. You can customize the coffee by adding more or less grounds/water as well as vanilla, cinnamon, Coacoa, etc.. for a personal, original flavor. One of my favorite aspects of this maker is it makes concentrate, unlike many cold brew makers that just make ready to drink coffee. This means you get more coffee for your time, and you can use concentrate in a wider variety of personalized coffee drinks. The only thing I could say that is a drawback is it DOES use a 16oz bag of coffee to make about 24-30oz of cold brew. It’s a high disproportion compared to the normal hot drip coffee user.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I really like this appliance. It's easy to use and makes really good cold brew concentrate. It's easy to clean. The only thing I don't like about it is that it takes up a fair amount of space, but it's not something that needs to stay on the counter all of the time.
customer_reviews.author: KillerBunny

customer_reviews.title: Unnecessary but delightful
customer_reviews.text: I probably could have just got a large container and some cheesecloth, but this kit is fun to use! I enjoy having "scientific" coffee in a conical flask, and the reusable filter is great. Does the rainpour thing on top make a difference? I suspect not, but it's fun and not fussy. Only heads up is that the whole thing is hand-wash except the flask. Also, I find it weird that there's no lid -- the part that goes on top has holes in it. One reviewer mentioned using press n seal, but I don't have any on hand and I'm not that skeeved out. It just seems weird!
customer_reviews.author: eggo

customer_reviews.title: Beaker is fragile and will break
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a year, but beaker is very, VERY fragile. We didn't even break the beaker it just cracked over night and spilled a whole carafe of cold brew all over our fridge. $18 in fresh, locally roasted coffee concentrate down the drain + a huge mess to clean up. Was happy with it until then but this is a serious design flaw. OXO should pony up for borilloscate glass (like Pyrex style glass) for a few bucks more and this would be a great little coffee maker. Until then, I'm forced to find an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: Leaks a bit
customer_reviews.text: Does what it advertises, but has a tendency to leak a little bit. If you're brewing a second batch while your carafe is already in the fridge, it is necessary to put a glass underneath to catch any drips that sneak their way out.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Leaky, Breaks Easily
customer_reviews.text: Total junk, look elsewhere. Mine slowly leaked as it brewed and the pour switch sticks, leaving you with your precious brew coming out uncontrollably. The carafe on mine also broke on first use, with a tiny bump. I’m surprised by OXO (am usually a fan) but this really doesn’t seem thought through.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Very happy! Delicious iced coffee at home!
customer_reviews.text: Really happy so far! I let the coffee brew for about 20 hours, and it was delicious! Lasts me about 2 days worth of coffee. The first time I used it, it was leaking as it brewed. I kept the beaker in place so it didn’t drip on my countertop. But I saw someone post about not overly tightening the top piece, so after I loosened it, it didn’t leak! It’s also super easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: nikki b

customer_reviews.title: Does what you need.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. One thing they don't point out is that you put the switch back up by pulling it out (towards yourself). If you try pushing it up you could break the plastic tab in there. I feel like the rain maker part is pointless. I think just having a lid would be better since less air will touch your brew. But my cold brew comes out fine anyway. I use light roast in the fridge for maximum smoothness. I'll even put ice cubes in with them just to make it extra cold. I haven't had issues with the carafe like other people but I also haven't thrown it around.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Brown

customer_reviews.title: Easily makes a great cold brew concentrate.
customer_reviews.text: This cold brew system works great. I wish it was smaller; it takes up a lot of room on my limited counterspace. Having said that, however, I am willing to sacrifice that space to end up with a great concentrate. On Sunday, my food prep day for the week, I can make two batches; enough concentrate to last me for a week. Thanks for a great product that is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: N. J. Scott-Smith

customer_reviews.title: League above Toddy
customer_reviews.text: My gosh I love this purchase. I’ve had it for a couple months now after using Toddy for years (and having to replace the Toddy canister once for a crack where the stopper inserts). Oxo is SO much easier to set up, filter, and clean, and it looks great on the counter when it’s brewing. I don’t even use paper filters with mine anymore as I’ve found the mesh filter works great with no real taste difference to me. I seriously wish I had switched to this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good Product, But There's A But.
customer_reviews.text: We're OXY fans, and this product does what it's supposed to do, brew coffee without heat. But, when you strain the concentrate into the carafe through the metal filter and a supplied paper filter (for good reason) added, the filtering process will take way longer then the instruction book's predicted twenty minutes to an hour. Skip adding the paper filter, and the filtering will go faster, but you'll find residue in your concentrate that you may want to filter out by pouring the concentrate through a coffee filter into a container and then pour that back into the convenient carafe.
customer_reviews.author: Vball

customer_reviews.title: Works well, takes up too much space
customer_reviews.text: I used the product to make iced coffee and it works well but is actually a very simple rig that takes up a good amount of space on the counter. I would not purchase again. I see there are less expensive alternatives on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mkendall

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: I like to use coarse grounds, I usually use 12 oz to 48 oz of water. After I fill the carafe, I might add another cup of water just to flush out all the concentrate. The carafe has worked well for me, I use the lid for measurement depending how strong the concentrate is. After I'm done, I put the grounds in my garden for mulch, the nutrients and it seems to repel insects.
customer_reviews.author: HJ

customer_reviews.title: Fool-proof, great coffee!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a way to continue my luxury of drinking cold brew during the quarantine, as I used to buy ready-made concentrate. When that became hard to find, I needed to find a way to make my own. This cold brew maker is fool-proof and amazing! I grind my own coarse beans, and have no grounds sneak through into my coffee. Takes a while to figure out your coffee to water ratio (instructions were a little off), but otherwise, this is a perfect cold brew maker.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean.  Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love cold brew, this is easy to use, easy to clean and the coffee is smooth. My only complaint is the top that goes over the beaker doesn't feel like it truly seals when storing the coffee. This is just a minor issue, coffee stays fresh for at least a week. I WOULD buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nukem

customer_reviews.title: Glass is too fragile!
customer_reviews.text: First time I purchased the glass top broke soon as I put the cap in. They sent another, but I've been through 4 or more since. The carafes have cracked just moving stuff around in the cabinet. I'm done buying replacements. Looking for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Nevin

customer_reviews.title: Worked magnificent for about 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product back in January 2017 and I had been making cold brew with it 2-3 times a month. The 10-40 grounds to water is easy to measure using a scale and the leaver to extract the coffee works well, though it got pretty hard to move as time went on. After about 2 months of having to screw the cap on the bottom tighter and tighter to keep the device from leaking it now leaks no matter what. I absolutely would recommend this product, as for its price point 2 years with 2-3 uses per month is good length of time for it to work without any trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Will E

customer_reviews.title: Best tasting cold brew coffee
customer_reviews.text: It makes good coffee and always makes a mess. Takes up a lot of counter space. The beaker that catches the coffee is made of thin Pyrex and has broken multiple times. Oxo did send a replacement beaker the two times that it broke. One of the times my friend was hand-washing it and it broke while they were hand washing it and cut her hand. And even told them they should replace that with something plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Trashisfree

customer_reviews.title: good coffee
customer_reviews.text: Not sure the drip rain thing actually does anything. The coffee is good, though. Just make sure the coffee was roasted/grounded for at least a week, otherwise the coffee will taste sour. We use the whole food brand dark roast decaff which uses the swiss water process and grind it on coarse grain at the store. ~10-12oz coffee grounds and ~40oz of water. We slowly pour a little over 8oz first, then let it sit for a few minutes, and then pour the rest (32oz) slowly. If the water is poured too fast, all the coffee grounds will float to the top, if poured slowly, it will still float, but it doesn't look as dense as when poured fast.
customer_reviews.author: R. Duong

customer_reviews.title: beautiful cold brew maker
customer_reviews.text: if you're looking to make cold brew, you cant go wrong with this kit. I love OXO products, and this doesnt disappoint. making the cold brew was very straightforward and easy- just make sure you have a good burr grinder. get this kit- you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Two Shoes

customer_reviews.title: Great except for the carafe
customer_reviews.text: The cold brew coffee maker works great, but the included carafe is definitely the weak point. The rest of the maker is made of plastic, but the carafe itself is incredibly thin glass. I was always very careful to hand wash and dry, but tonight when I slid another glass container into the fridge next to it I bumped the carafe and it shattered. You'd be better off using a mason jar or something similar as opposed to what's included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great concept and idea
customer_reviews.text: Great concept and idea. I love that everything is included and - for the most part - everything stores and stacks away easily. It's not quiet as easy to clean as the video indicates and the only other issue is really trying to find the right grind. I've run through several different grind types (coarse, super coarse, etc.) and each still feels like it results in the unit draining incredibly slow and becoming clogged. Other than those small issues, it's a great cold-coffee brewer unit for someone just getting started or wanting to break into the at-home cold coffee brewing scene.
customer_reviews.author: Omega

customer_reviews.title: Makes a good cup, but...
customer_reviews.text: Makes a good cup, but at the cost of using extra coffee. It's about 20-21 grams a cup vs 12-14 of a standard cup. The coffee it makes will last up to 2 weeks, so the extra cost comes with convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Broken after less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice coffee maker for the (almost) two months it worked. I only used it a handful of times and the lever is stuck in the down position. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: douggie ham

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased so far with my purchase!!! Still experimenting with the type of coffee bean used as well as the coarseness of the grind. But the product works very well and is easy to clean! It is also much less expensive, over the long haul, to make your own cold-brewed coffee than it is to buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: My brew is cold
customer_reviews.text: OK, yes, so the components of this appliance are not of the most robust construction. The glass carafe (as you've heard) is made of some of the thinnest glass I've ever held. But...the actual design is fantastic. It's incredibly easy to use, it drains efficiently, it cleans thoroughly in about a minute (just be really careful of that glass carafe!) and man, what a fantastic cup of coffee. Once you try this cold brew, you will not go back to the old-school steaming pots of acid filled hot brew. Bon apetite!
customer_reviews.author: Road Warrior

customer_reviews.title: The big easy...
customer_reviews.text: My Primulus cold brew fell apart into my coffee cup. Needed a replacement, read some reviews and picked this one. One day delivery and I was back in cold brew heaven. The Oxo does no magic, it all comes down to your coffee and water but it is simple to use, easy to clean and the carraffe fits in the fridge. The only negative thing I could say is the unit is as big as a 10 cup coffee maker so it will take up counter space. The pieces will nest for storage if you don't use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: P.C. Salter

customer_reviews.title: Makes awesome cold brew!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the carafe. And it makes a much larger batch of coffee than others I have tried. It is easy to clean. It may not be pretty but does a great job and then easily stores beneath the counter.
customer_reviews.author: Phil D.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty good, not sure if it is worth the extra $$ though compared to other cold brewers
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Very OK
customer_reviews.text: I like this product and use it regularly, but I do not quite see how this differs from leaving coffee overnight in a french press and then pressing it in the morning. The raindrop top seems a bit gimmicky. I do not feel remorseful for buying this, but I do not this is that much better or necessary.
customer_reviews.author: R. A. Elliott III

customer_reviews.title: Another excellent performer by Oxo
customer_reviews.text: If coffee acidity creates stomach problems, cold brewed coffee is worth checking out, and this Oxo cold brew Unit facilitates making it. The design was well thought-out: easy to set up, easy to use, easy to clean. I prefer my coffee hot, but I've made a very concentrated brew, then add hot water, rendering something similar to an Americano. I've had zero issues with the Oxo unit & would recommend it over the others.
customer_reviews.author: Maukahound

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great product. After trying cold brew coffee from Whole Foods, I started researching how to make my own. I settled on this gadget and used the grinder at the market on some organic decaf coffee. I made 2 batches in 2 days and they both came out perfect! I have no scale so I used about 31/2 cups coffee to 5 cups water. I brewed for 24 hours. I drink my hot and ice coffee black so I can really notice if it is too weak, acidic etc. It is extremely smooth and delicious. I use a 2:1 or 3:1 ratio of concentrate to water depending on my mood.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca ReaganTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: and it's super simple to figure out and the cold brew tastes ...
customer_reviews.text: I brew cold brew in here for my coffee shop every other day, and it's super simple to figure out and the cold brew tastes amazing. It cleans super easily, the only thing I'm worried about is breaking the beaker the brew drains into. Hopefully OXO sells just the beaker for when that day inevitable happens. Also, it's fun to look at and a great conversation piece, my customers end up trying cold brew because they see this cool contraption.
customer_reviews.author: Lynsey

customer_reviews.title: Leaky
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee. Horrible design that leaks. Filter paper that comes with it clogs to easily. Update (9/16/18): Worse off now after contacting and having gasket replaced due to faulty manufacturer. Still leaks (quite a problem in the fridge but at least it smells like good coffee). Fourth time calling FINALLY got a new unit sent. Same problem still exists. You're better off with a toddy or find a good pre-made cold brew and save yourself the hassle of this
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: You must brew at least 8-10 hours. For good coffee. For extra strong I brew it 12 hours.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this back in the summer 2018. But I like to really try my product's I purchase, before I post a review. With that being said, I absolutely love my cold brewer. It is by far the best brewer I have purchased. If you like strong coffee I use 10-12 tbsp if medium brew I use 8-9 tbsp . I would recommend this all day, everyday to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Gail18056

customer_reviews.title: It's great!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical about it, but decided to give it a try based on a few reviews I had read. I love it. The sediment was what I was concerned about and very little sediment comes through the filter. I do pour into another carafe to store in the fridge. By taking a bit of care to pour slowly, the little bit of sediment stays in the the flask. Cold brew is my favorite type of coffee now. Even bought another one for the office.
customer_reviews.author: Carole

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this...
customer_reviews.text: After reading so many great reviews on this cold brew coffee maker I was disappointed that I had to return it. The latch to drain the coffee never worked well and kept getting stuck. Sometime it worked most of the time it didn't. The drain filter with and without the paper filter never drained the whole pot of brewed coffee. I always had to finish draining with a coffee filter from a mesh drainer.
customer_reviews.author: Girasole

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee
customer_reviews.text: I have been on a quest for the perfect cup for years. Really..this is the winner by far. Easy and convenient for me. I prepare the night before and flip the leaver first thing in the morning. I'm still playing around a bit with ratio of coffee to water, have even used coffee grounds twice with good results. I usually drink iced coffee but it was no problem to heat for a friend. Can't think of anything I would change. Well maybe the price.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Obsoleted our old coffeemaker!
customer_reviews.text: We are amazed at how smooth and delicious this coffee is! We're hooked. It's not hard to make or to clean. My only complaint is that the carafe is kind of hard to hold onto with one hand, and made of thin glass, and I'm sure at some point I'm going to drop and break it. However, I do like that the carafe's top can be used to measure out the correct serving of coffee. Overall, very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Way too long to drain!!
customer_reviews.text: Takes way too long to drain.... ~6+ hrs at least.... and this was with stirring constantly and scraping the filter. Tried the metal filter And per filters with the same result. Each time is with the coarsest “French press” style grind.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love my cold brew maker best tasting and if you have a grinder with coarse grind you don’t need the filters
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Great if it didn't Leak
customer_reviews.text: This would be a very good cold brew maker if not for the fact that the filter cap leaks no matter how tight you can get it, wasting up to half of the coffee. I contacted Oxo back in May and they agreed to send a replacement when it was back in stock by late July. After not hearing or receiving anything, I had to contact them myself to find out that they pushed back their estimate until September. I appreciate that they are working to fix the problem, but better communication would be great as well. I probably won't buy again from the company
customer_reviews.author: Trev Zumpano

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This went back as soon as I put it together. It’s very flimsy and the parts are plastic. Save your money and buy the gorgeous glass and wood version made in Japan.
customer_reviews.author: jodigirl11

customer_reviews.title: Works great... for a while
customer_reviews.text: I had a good six month run with this brewer and after that, my yields grew smaller and smaller. The filter stops working and doesn't permit any water through at this point - giving me about 20% output after over an hour of draining. Really disappointing and I advise anyone to go into this purchase knowing its limited shelf life.
customer_reviews.author: bugula

customer_reviews.title: great for cold brew

customer_reviews.title: Great smooth coffee.  Do extra coarse grind, 1/3 concentrate, 2/3 hot from tea pot
customer_reviews.text: Amazing coffee cold or hot. Make sure you read all the instructions. Especially if you grind fresh, let it release for 10 min before you mix it. Also, it's a concentrate - after a 24 hr process, we like 1/3 concentrate and 2/3 hot water from our tea pot. Makes a great cup of coffee that tastes like a high end percolator. Do an extra coarse grind:  For me, I did two pulses in the grinder, shook it up (to ensure even grinding) and repeated (3 times) till it looked extra coarse. I would pick out the few whole beans that didn't grind.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan MacFarlane

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use - but - caution - use a coarse grind
customer_reviews.text: So, most folks probably already know this and it makes sense - but be sure to use a coarse grind for the coffee. The main problem is I need to be careful otherwise I drink too much and end up being way over-caffeinated.

product_meta.title: OXO Good Grips 32 Ounce Cold Brew Coffee Maker
product_meta.description:
The cold-brew process makes smoother, less bitter and less acidic hot or iced coffee. Steeping the grounds in cold water releases only the most aromatic flavors. Plus the concentrate created from the cold-brew process stays fresh longer than regular coffee.

The OXO Good Grips Cold Brew Coffee Maker brings the cold-brew process to your kitchen, offering smooth, low-acid coffee without a trip to the cafe. Just add coffee grounds to the Brewing Container and fill the Rainmaker top with water. The Rainmaker ensures that water is distributed evenly over the coffee grounds. Let the mixture steep for 12 - 24 hours. When you’re ready to enjoy, the Brew-Release Switch allows for easy control of the draining process. The stainless steel ultra-fine mesh filter can be removed for quick cleanup.

Once the concentrate is prepared, mix with ice and water for iced coffee or hot water for hot coffee. Milk can also be added. Tea-lover? The OXO Good Grips Cold Brew Coffee Maker will steep and strain your favorite tea into sealable, glass carafe.

For best results, use coarse ground coffee. Finer grounds may prevent the OXO Good Grips Cold Brew Coffee Maker from draining properly.



BRAND STORY
By OXO

Simple Brew Release switch controls filtration process with one flick
Brews smooth, low acid concentrate for cold or hot coffee anytime
Ultra fine, stainless steel mesh filter is reusable and easy to clean
Borosilicate glass carafe includes measurement markings, pairs with stopper to keep coffee fresh in refrigerator
Small countertop footprint, easy disassembly for cleanup and compact storage
